text:
For the latest of Windows the process of updating WinRE is now fully automated.
The following versions of Windows require no additional steps as WinRE will be
updated as a part of Latest Cumulative Update if you are getting updates from
Windows Update and WSUS.: 
* Windows 11 Version 23H2 for x64-based Systems
 * Windows 11 Version 23H2 for ARM64-based Systems
 * Windows 11 Version 22H2 for x64-based Systems
 * Windows 11 Version 22H2 for ARM64-based Systems 
https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/vulnerability/CVE-2024-20666
 
For 22H2 it's included. 
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-hardware/manufacture/desktop/add-update-to-winre?view=windows-11#check-the-winre-image-version
 
Use the reagent c thingy to figure out which partition location 
Then use dism to query what ya got. So far so good. 
Office PC.
Windows 11 22H2
Installed no errors 
[cid:] 
Note 69.18 free, not 250 
Details for image :
\\?\GLOBALROOT\device\harddisk0\partition4\Recovery\WindowsRE\winre.wim 
Index : 1
Name : WINRE
Description : Microsoft Windows Recover Environment (amd64)
Size : 3,220,471,974 bytes
WIM Bootable : No
Architecture : x64
Hal : <undefined

metadata.topic: Win11 22h2 and later - they don't need 250 free?  Yes?  No? and what about checking if you are patched? (aka I'm confused)
metadata.subject: [patchmanagement] Win11 22h2 and later - they don't need 250 free?  Yes?  No? and what about checking if you are patched? (aka I'm confused)
metadata.email_text_original:
For the latest of Windows the process of updating WinRE is now fully automated.
The following versions of Windows require no additional steps as WinRE will be
updated as a part of Latest Cumulative Update if you are getting updates from
Windows Update and WSUS.: 
* Windows 11 Version 23H2 for x64-based Systems
 * Windows 11 Version 23H2 for ARM64-based Systems
 * Windows 11 Version 22H2 for x64-based Systems
 * Windows 11 Version 22H2 for ARM64-based Systems 
https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/vulnerability/CVE-2024-20666
[https://can01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fmsrc.microsoft.com%2Fupdate-guide%2Fvulnerability%2FCVE-2024-20666&data=05%7C02%7Cemail_ingestion%40bighatgroup.com%7C4b1185ff9cd3446a38d408dc1c78042f%7C5a01497e1bcb4711b6e6d24f4ab00393%7C0%7C0%7C638416549004613463%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=g0wX%2Fs8zO43XJ988eoUnTBUnWDNZLhz8L%2FanK3YZucI%3D&reserved=0] 
For 22H2 it's included. 
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-hardware/manufacture/desktop/add-update-to-winre?view=windows-11#check-the-winre-image-version
[https://can01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Flearn.microsoft.com%2Fen-us%2Fwindows-hardware%2Fmanufacture%2Fdesktop%2Fadd-update-to-winre%3Fview%3Dwindows-11%23check-the-winre-image-version&data=05%7C02%7Cemail_ingestion%40bighatgroup.com%7C4b1185ff9cd3446a38d408dc1c78042f%7C5a01497e1bcb4711b6e6d24f4ab00393%7C0%7C0%7C638416549004624225%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=slyuGWyThuuecSups9fHzwK5G6Wf2hn%2BkuYBqIox1Rg%3D&reserved=0] 
Use the reagent c thingy to figure out which partition location 
Then use dism to query what ya got.  So far so good. 
Office PC.
Windows 11 22H2
Installed no errors 
[cid:embe767816-e891-4de0-8ab8-b167608e6b60@e53fc1c0.com] 
Note 69.18 free, not 250 
Details for image :
\\?\GLOBALROOT\device\harddisk0\partition4\Recovery\WindowsRE\winre.wim

Size : 3,220,471,974 bytes

ServicePack Level : 0

Created : 5/6/2022 - 9:53:32 PM
Modified : 1/9/2024 - 9:13:15 PM
Languages :
        en-US (Default)
The operation completed successfully. 
C:\Windows\System32> 
So build 3000, not 3007 
Make sure that the ServicePackBuild is greater than or equal to the UBR for the
update that you added. For example, for Windows 11, version 22H2, the November
security update would show 819 as the SerivcePack Build, since full version
number for that update is 22621.819.
https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/topic/january-9-2024-kb5034123-os-builds-22621-3007-and-22631-3007-3f7e169f-56e8-4e6e-b6b8-41f4aa4b9b88
[https://can01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fsupport.microsoft.com%2Fen-us%2Ftopic%2Fjanuary-9-2024-kb5034123-os-builds-22621-3007-and-22631-3007-3f7e169f-56e8-4e6e-b6b8-41f4aa4b9b88&data=05%7C02%7Cemail_ingestion%40bighatgroup.com%7C4b1185ff9cd3446a38d408dc1c78042f%7C5a01497e1bcb4711b6e6d24f4ab00393%7C0%7C0%7C638416549004634646%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=3FhDOudyNQZWdpBmh%2F7c7%2FYPzEg6M4rEdhN76N9bHyI%3D&reserved=0]
so since Win11 January 9th patch is 22621.3007 and 22631.3007, shouldn't that be
a 3007, not a 3000? 
--
